item.title: Dangerous traffic light crossing for cyclists and vehicles, 24th February
item.description:
I work at Spring Hill GP practice on Belfast Road, N16 6UH. I cycle to work. When I cross the traffic lights on my bike from Belfast Road, going straight across to Manor Road, the vehicles coming in the opposite direction from Manor Road to turn right never give the right of way to me or other cyclists of vehicles going straight on. They go fast and turn right in front of me, leaving no opportunity to cross until the last moment when the lights turn red. This is very dangerous. I always feel that I am going to be knocked down by a car of van turning right out of Manor Road. Please change the lights so they turn green for cyclists or vehicles exiting Belfast Road first, or give a separate green signal for Belfast Road to allow safe exit from this street which is now in much more frequent use since the new building for Spring Hill GP Practice. Many thanks, Dr Anna Barber
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Manor Parade, West Hackney, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plender Street from Camden High Street, 24th February
item.description:
No markings for pedestrian crossing. Drivers turning right from Camden High Street do not give way. They get upset at the people who started their crossing while the car approaches the corner but before they make the turn. Even if drivers had way it is not clear for pedestrians to start crossing because some cars are faster than others.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Plender Street, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cleaned all that flytipping from the verges, 24th February
item.description:
Both sides are now clean and I am happy. I know you wouldn’t do it anyway because you keep telling me it’s private land but you don’t enforce any environmental law on the owners so the area naturally becomes a landfill. Some local residents don’t want to live in crap so take matters in their own hands. I’m voting Lib Dem’s this election, at least they acknowledge the flytipping crisis and general degradation of standards. And the country dares to call itself “developed”, what a joke…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salter Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass cut too early, 24th February
item.description:
Here we go again! The annual pain! The mowers are out! No time to shout! No chance for a dandelion to flower! Early bees must cower! The early nectar has been killed, though the council contract is fulfilled, Kill off every sward just for that 'coveted' Green Award! Call yerselves Bromley 'Green'? This is yet to be seen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bellefield Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
